Type.Name: Component
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: The ATK interface provided by UI components which occupy a physical area on the screen.

remarks.para: The ATK interface provided by UI components which occupy a physical area on the screen.

This should be implemented by most if not all UI elements with an actual on-screen presence, i.e. components which can be said to have a screen-coordinate bounding box. Virtually all widgets will need to have implementations provided for their corresponding class. In short, only UI elements which are* not* GUI elements will omit this ATK interface.
A possible exception might be textual information with a transparent background, in which case text glyph bounding box information is provided by .

Docs.summary: Remove the handler from the list of functions to be executed when this object receives focus events (in or out).
Docs.param: The handler id of the focus handler to be removed from component.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetPosition (int x, int y, Atk.CoordType coord_type);

Docs.summary: Sets the postition of this component.
Docs.param: X coordinate.
Y coordinate.
Specifies whether the coordinates are relative to the screen or to the components top level window.
Docs.returns: or whether or not the position was set or not.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetExtents (int x, int y, int width, int height, Atk.CoordType coord_type);

Docs.summary: Sets the extents of this component.
Docs.param: X coordinate.
Y coordinate.
Width to set for this component.
Height to set for this component.
Specifies whether the coordinates are relative to the screen or to the components top level window.
Docs.returns: or whether the extents were set or not.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetSize (int width, int height);

Docs.summary: Set the size of this component in terms of width and height.
Docs.param: Width to set for this component.
Height to set for this component.
Docs.returns: or whether the size was set or not.

Docs.summary: Add the specified handler to the set of functions to be called when this object receives focus events (in or out).
Docs.param: The to be attached to this component.
Docs.returns: A handler id which can be used in or zero if the handler was already added.

remarks.para: Add the specified handler to the set of functions to be called when this object receives focus events (in or out).
If the handler is already added it is not added again.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Contains (int x, int y, Atk.CoordType coord_type);

Docs.summary: Checks whether the specified point is within the extent of this component.
Docs.param: X coordinate
Y coordinate
Specifies whether the coordinates are relative to the screen or to the components top level window.
Docs.returns: or indicating whether the specified point is within the extent of the component or not.

MemberSignature.Value: public Atk.Object RefAccessibleAtPoint (int x, int y, Atk.CoordType coord_type);

Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'int'
To be added: an object of type 'int'
To be added: an object of type 'Atk.CoordType'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Atk.Object'

Docs.summary: Gets the Z order of the component.
Docs.value: The value G_MININT will be returned if the layer of the component is not ATK_LAYER_MDI or ATK_LAYER_WINDOW.

Docs.summary: Gets the layer of this component.
Docs.value: An which is the layer of the component.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetPosition (out int x, out int y, Atk.CoordType coord_type);

Docs.summary: Gets the position of component in the form of a point specifying this component's top-left corner.
Docs.param: X coordinate position
Y coordinate position
Specifies whether the coordinates are relative to the screen or to the components top level window.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetExtents (out int x, out int y, out int width, out int height, Atk.CoordType coord_type);

Docs.summary: Gets the rectangle which gives the extent of this component.

Y coordinate position
Width
Height
Specifies whether the coordinates are relative to the screen or to the components top level window.
